Identification.LongTitle: Order Assigning to the Minister of the Environment the Administration, Management and Control of Certain Public Lands

Provision.Text: Whereas the Governor in Council is satisfied that the public lands described in the schedule hereto are required for wildlife research, conservation or interpretation.

Therefore, Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of the Environment, pursuant to subsection 4(1) of the Canada Wildlife Act, is pleased hereby to assign to the Minister of the Environment the administration, management and control of the public lands described in the schedule hereto.

Being all those lots in the Province of New Brunswick, in the County of Sunbury, in the Parishes of Maugerville and Sheffield, identified as lots 2, 3, 4, 5, 10, 13, 15, 17, 23, 24, 26, 27, 32, 33, 36, 36A, 38, 41, 42, 44, 45, 46, 49, 54, 56, 59, 60, 61, 62, 66, 68A, 71, 74, 84, 86, 87, 89, 89A and 94; all according to Plan 71087, Canada Lands Surveys Records, Ottawa, containing together about 1,769.5 hectares.
